name: UpdateRestrictionPolicy
description:
Update the restriction policy for a Datadog resource.

Use this tool to update the restriction policy associated with various Datadog resources, such as dashboards, integration services, notebooks, and more. You can specify the resource type and the new access permissions like viewer, editor, or others depending on the resource.

parameters.name: resource_identifier
parameters.description: Identifier of the resource, formatted as `type:id`. Includes supported types like `dashboard`, `integration-service`, `notebook`, and others.

parameters.name: restriction_policy_payload
parameters.description: The payload for the restriction policy update, including attributes like bindings, principals, and relation types.

principals.description:
An array of principals. A principal is a subject or group of subjects.
Each principal is formatted as `type:id`. Supported types: `role`, `team`, `user`, and `org`.
The org ID can be obtained through the api/v2/current_user API.
The user principal type accepts service account IDs.

id.description: The identifier, always equivalent to the value specified in the `resource_id` path parameter.

parameters.name: allow_self_lockout
parameters.description: Set to true to allow admins to remove their own access from the resource. Default is false, preventing self-lockout.

value_schema.description: Allows admins (users with the `user_access_manage` permission) to remove their own access from the resource if set to `true`. By default, this is set to `false`, preventing admins from locking themselves out.
